eng: a written or spoken message that reminds someone to do something
chisen: 如果他忘了付房租，女房東就會去信提醒他。
engsen: If he forgot to pay his rent , his landlady would send him a reminder .

chi: （告知該做某事的）通知單，提示信，提醒（的話），提示
eng: a written or spoken message that reminds someone to do something
chisen: 媽媽最後又提醒了我一句要在晚上11點之前回家後就把我打發走了。
engsen: Mum sent me off with a final reminder to be back before 11 p.m .

chi: 使人想起…的東西；引起對…回憶的人；提醒人…的事物
eng: a person or thing that makes you remember a particular person, event, or situation
chisen: 派翠西亞的短篇小說提醒人們，在如今實質上仍屬於男性的世界裡，女性會是多麼的易受傷害。
engsen: Patricia's story is a reminder of how vulnerable women can be in what is still essentially a man's world .

eng: to pay back or to reward someone or something
chisen: 他不得不賣了車還銀行貸款。
engsen: He had to sell his car to repay the bank loan .

eng: to pay back or to reward someone or something
chisen: 你對我這麽好，我怎麽才能報答你呢？
engsen: How can I ever repay you for all your kindness ?

eng: to produce a copy of something, or to be copied in a production process
chisen: 他的作品被翻印在宣傳頁和雜誌上。
engsen: His work was reproduced on leaflets and magazines .

eng: to produce a copy of something, or to be copied in a production process
chisen: 他們說這材料印得太模糊，無法複印清楚。
engsen: They said the printing was too faint to reproduce well .

eng: When living things reproduce, they produce young plants, animals, etc.
chisen: 這些植物既可以進行有性繁殖，也可以進行無性繁殖。
engsen: These plants can reproduce sexually and asexually .

eng: When living things reproduce, they produce young plants, animals, etc.
chisen: 有些生物的生存和繁殖能力比其他生物強。
engsen: Some creatures were better at surviving and reproducing themselves than others .

eng: to feel angry because you have been forced to accept someone or something that you do not like
chisen: 她對她父親新娶的妻子恨之入骨。
engsen: She bitterly resented her father's new wife .

eng: to feel angry because you have been forced to accept someone or something that you do not like
chisen: 他討厭非要向人們解釋他的工作。
engsen: He resents having to explain his work to other people .

eng: to live, have your home, or stay in a place
chisen: 這家人現居住在法國南部。
engsen: The family now resides in southern France .

eng: a home
chisen: 總督官邸
engsen: the Governor's official residence

eng: a person who lives or has their home in a place
chisen: 英國／澳大利亞居民
engsen: a resident of the UK/Australia

eng: a person who lives or has their home in a place
chisen: 當地居民對停車位短缺一事非常惱火。
engsen: The local residents were angry at the lack of parking spaces .

eng: a person who lives or has their home in a place
chisen: 這家旅館的酒吧只對其住客開放。
engsen: The hotel bar was only open to residents (= to people staying at the hotel) .

chi: （美國的）高級專科住院實習醫生
eng: a doctor who is still training, and who works in a hospital
chisen: 她現在波士頓綜合醫院腫瘤科做高級專科住院實習醫生。
engsen: She's a first-year resident in oncology at Boston General Hospital .

eng: a place where many people go for rest, sport, or another stated purpose
chisen: 旅遊勝地
engsen: a tourist resort

eng: a place where many people go for rest, sport, or another stated purpose
chisen: 度假勝地
engsen: a holiday resort

eng: a place where many people go for rest, sport, or another stated purpose
chisen: 海濱／海灘度假勝地
engsen: a seaside/beach resort

eng: the fact that you have to do something because there is no other way of achieving something
chisen: 他沒有採取暴力手段，而是透過合法途徑拿到了這筆錢。
engsen: He got hold of the money legally , without resort to violence .

eng: to control the actions or behaviour of someone by force, especially in order to stop them from doing something, or to limit the growth or force of something
chisen: 他出手打人，四個員警才把他制服。
engsen: When he started fighting , it took four police officers to restrain him .

eng: to control the actions or behaviour of someone by force, especially in order to stop them from doing something, or to limit the growth or force of something
chisen: 她氣得幾乎都控制不住自己。
engsen: She was so angry that she could hardly restrain herself .

eng: to control the actions or behaviour of someone by force, especially in order to stop them from doing something, or to limit the growth or force of something
chisen: 你應該儘量控制自己的野心，更現實一些。
engsen: You should try to restrain your ambitions and be more realistic .

eng: If an activity resumes, or if you resume it, it starts again after a pause.
chisen: 春天將恢復正常服務。
engsen: Normal services will be resumed in the spring .

eng: If an activity resumes, or if you resume it, it starts again after a pause.
chisen: 他停下來呷了一口水，然後繼續發言。
engsen: He stopped to take a sip of water and then resumed speaking .

eng: If an activity resumes, or if you resume it, it starts again after a pause.
chisen: 會談預定今天繼續進行。
engsen: The talks are due to resume today .

eng: to answer someone quickly in an angry or funny way
chisen: 「那不關你的事！」她反駁道。
engsen: "That doesn't concern you!" she retorted .

chi: （使）反向；（使）倒轉；徹底改變；推翻
eng: to change the direction, order, position, result, etc. of something to its opposite
chisen: 新經理希望能夠扭轉公司江河日下的狀況。
engsen: The new manager hoped to reverse the decline in the company's fortunes .

chi: （使）反向；（使）倒轉；徹底改變；推翻
eng: to change the direction, order, position, result, etc. of something to its opposite
chisen: 你找到了工作，我倒沒有工作了，我們的情況正好互換了。
engsen: Now that you have a job and I don't , our situations are reversed .

chi: （使）反向；（使）倒轉；徹底改變；推翻
eng: to change the direction, order, position, result, etc. of something to its opposite
chisen: 上訴法院推翻了先前的判決。
engsen: The Court of Appeal reversed the earlier judgment .

eng: to drive a vehicle backwards
chisen: 他倒車時撞到了路燈柱，造成車尾受損。
engsen: He reversed into a lamppost and damaged the back of the car .

eng: to drive a vehicle backwards
chisen: 她把車倒進停車位。
engsen: She reversed the car into the parking space .

chi: （使）甦醒；（使）復原；（使）復興；（使）重新流行
eng: to come or bring something back to life, health, existence, or use
chisen: 使某人重新燃起希望／重樹信心／時來運轉
engsen: to revive someone's hopes/confidence/fortunes

chi: （使）甦醒；（使）復原；（使）復興；（使）重新流行
eng: to come or bring something back to life, health, existence, or use
chisen: 澆了一些水後，我的植物立即又生機盎然了。
engsen: My plants revived as soon as I gave them some water .

chi: （使）甦醒；（使）復原；（使）復興；（使）重新流行
eng: to come or bring something back to life, health, existence, or use
chisen: 沖個熱水澡，喝杯茶，你就會恢復精力的。
engsen: A hot shower and a cup of tea will revive you .

eng: If a large number of people revolt, they refuse to be controlled or ruled, and take action against authority, often violent action.
chisen: 人們奮起反抗外來統治，並成立了自己的政府。
engsen: The people revolted against foreign rule and established their own government .

eng: to make someone feel unpleasantly shocked or disgusted
chisen: 她家裡又髒又亂，我們看著心裡生厭。
engsen: We were revolted by the dirt and mess in her house .

eng: to make someone feel unpleasantly shocked or disgusted
chisen: 這個世界有數以百萬計的人因饑餓掙扎在死亡線上，但卻有那麽多的錢花在軍備上，這真讓我感到震驚。
engsen: It revolts me to know that the world spends so much money on arms when millions are dying of hunger .

eng: to move or cause something to move around a central point or line
chisen: 地球圍繞太陽轉。
engsen: The earth revolves around the sun .

eng: to move or cause something to move around a central point or line
chisen: 炮塔旋轉著，最後炮口瞄準了正在前進的士兵。
engsen: The gun turret revolved until the gun was aimed at the advancing soldiers .

eng: a bone that curves round from your back to your chest
chisen: 我兒子從梯子上摔了下來，摔斷了一根肋骨。
engsen: My son broke a rib when he fell off a ladder .

eng: a long, narrow raised part of a surface, especially a high edge along a mountain
chisen: 我們沿著狹窄的山脊行進。
engsen: We walked along the narrow mountain ridge .

eng: a long, narrow raised part of a surface, especially a high edge along a mountain
chisen: 今天下午高壓脊將會帶來好天氣。
engsen: A ridge (= a narrow area) of high pressure will bring good weather this afternoon .

eng: stupid or unreasonable and deserving to be laughed at
chisen: 我戴這頂帽子看著很可笑嗎？
engsen: Do I look ridiculous in this hat ?

eng: stupid or unreasonable and deserving to be laughed at
chisen: 別傻了！我才住不起那樣的旅館呢。
engsen: Don't be so ridiculous ! I can't possibly afford to stay in a hotel like that .

eng: stupid or unreasonable and deserving to be laughed at
chisen: 指望一個兩歲的孩子能閱讀真是太荒唐了！
engsen: It's ridiculous to expect a two-year-old to be able to read !

chi: 僵硬的；固定的；不能彎曲的
eng: stiff or fixed; not able to be bent or moved
chisen: 堅固的鋼筋混凝土結構
engsen: a rigid steel and concrete structure

chi: 僵硬的；固定的；不能彎曲的
eng: stiff or fixed; not able to be bent or moved
chisen: 我被嚇得呆若木雞。
engsen: I was rigid with (= stiff and unable to move because of) fear .

eng: the outer, often curved or circular, edge of something
chisen: 杯口上碰出了裂紋，碎了。
engsen: The rim of the cup was chipped and broken .

eng: the outer, often curved or circular, edge of something
chisen: 我的閱讀用放大鏡鑲著金屬絲邊。
engsen: My reading glasses have wire rims .

eng: to pull apart; to tear or be torn violently and quickly
chisen: 他彎腰時把新褲子撐開了線。
engsen: His new trousers ripped when he bent down .

eng: to pull apart; to tear or be torn violently and quickly
chisen: 我的襯衫被一顆釘子劃破了。
engsen: I ripped my shirt on a nail .

eng: to pull apart; to tear or be torn violently and quickly
chisen: 她興奮地撕開了包裹。
engsen: She excitedly ripped the package open .

chi: （從光碟把圖片或聲音）擷取／複製（至電腦）
eng: to copy pictures or sounds from a CD or DVD onto a computer
chisen: 怎樣能把DVD電影擷取到我的硬碟上？
engsen: How do I rip a DVD movie to my hard drive ?

eng: a small wave on the surface of water
chisen: 她扔了一塊石頭，湖面泛起陣陣漣漪。
engsen: The stone she threw caused ripples to spread across the lake .

eng: a person, group, etc. competing with others for the same thing or in the same area
chisen: 他以領先20分的成績打敗了和他水平最接近的對手。
engsen: He beat his closest/nearest rival by 20 marks .

eng: a person, group, etc. competing with others for the same thing or in the same area
chisen: 這些公司生産的玩具跟我們的産品爭奪市場。
engsen: The companies produce rival versions of the toy .

eng: to move about or travel, especially without a clear idea of what you are going to do
chisen: 酒館關門後，成群結夥的年輕人在城裡街道上遊蕩。
engsen: After the bars close , gangs of youths roam the city streets .

eng: to move about or travel, especially without a clear idea of what you are going to do
chisen: 她花了一年的時間在美國各地遊歷，一路在酒吧和飯店裡打工。
engsen: She roamed around America for a year , working in bars and restaurants .

chi: （産於歐洲的）鴝，知更鳥；（産於北美的）旅鶇，美洲知更鳥
eng: a small, brown European bird with a red front, or a similar but slightly larger brown bird of North America
chisen: 知更鳥在冬季最常見，經常被畫在聖誕卡上。
engsen: Robins mostly appear in the winter and are commonly pictured on Christmas cards .

chi: （人或動物）強壯的，茁壯的；（東西或系統）堅固的，耐用的，結實的
eng: (of a person or animal) strong and healthy, or (of an object or system) strong and unlikely to break or fail
chisen: 他看起來非常強壯健康。
engsen: He looks robust and healthy enough .

chi: （人或動物）強壯的，茁壯的；（東西或系統）堅固的，耐用的，結實的
eng: (of a person or animal) strong and healthy, or (of an object or system) strong and unlikely to break or fail
chisen: 一雙耐穿的遠足鞋
engsen: a robust pair of walking boots

chi: （人或動物）強壯的，茁壯的；（東西或系統）堅固的，耐用的，結實的
eng: (of a person or animal) strong and healthy, or (of an object or system) strong and unlikely to break or fail
chisen: 蓬勃發展的經濟
engsen: a robust economy

eng: a long, thin pole made of wood or metal
chisen: 他得到一根釣魚竿作為生日禮物。
engsen: He was given a fishing rod for his birthday .

eng: a long, thin pole made of wood or metal
chisen: 混凝土內加入鋼筋變得更加牢固。
engsen: The concrete is strengthened with steel rods .

eng: waste material or things that are no longer wanted or needed
chisen: 我今天早晨忘了把垃圾拿出去讓人收走。
engsen: I forgot to put the rubbish out this morning .

eng: waste material or things that are no longer wanted or needed
chisen: 把空盒子放在垃圾桶裡。
engsen: Put the empty box in the rubbish bin .

eng: waste material or things that are no longer wanted or needed
chisen: 把這件舊傢俱扔到垃圾場去。
engsen: Take the old furniture to the rubbish dump .

chi: 堅固的；耐用的；結實的；簡單皮實的
eng: strong and simple; not delicate
chisen: 吉普車是種很堅固耐用的車，專為崎嶇難行的路況而設計的。
engsen: Jeeps are rugged vehicles , designed for rough conditions .

chi: 發出隆隆聲；發出轆轆聲；發出低沈連續的響聲
eng: to make a continuous low sound
chisen: 不好意思，我肚子在咕咕叫——我一整天都沒吃東西了。
engsen: Please excuse my stomach rumbling - I haven't eaten all day .

chi: 發出隆隆聲；發出轆轆聲；發出低沈連續的響聲
eng: to make a continuous low sound
chisen: 雷聲在遠處隆隆作響。
engsen: Thunder rumbled in the distance .

chi: 發現，察覺，看穿（某人的秘密或非法事情的真相）
eng: to discover the true facts about someone or something secret and often illegal
chisen: 他的老闆最終看穿了他，把他解雇了。
engsen: His boss eventually rumbled him , and he was sacked .

chi: 使（紙或樹葉等）沙沙作響，使發出輕輕的摩擦聲；使沙沙作響地移動
eng: If things such as paper or leaves rustle, or if you rustle them, they move about and make a soft, dry sound.
chisen: 樹葉在微風中颯颯作響。
engsen: The leaves rustled in the breeze .

chi: 使（紙或樹葉等）沙沙作響，使發出輕輕的摩擦聲；使沙沙作響地移動
eng: If things such as paper or leaves rustle, or if you rustle them, they move about and make a soft, dry sound.
chisen: 他嘩啦嘩啦地翻動文件，以此來掩飾他的尷尬。
engsen: He rustled his papers (= noisily moved them about) to hide his embarrassment .

chi: （尤指因與神有關而）神聖的，值得崇敬的
eng: considered to be holy and deserving respect, especially because of a connection with a god
chisen: 對阿帕契人而言，這一個地區是神聖的。
engsen: This area is sacred to the Apaches .

chi: 馬鞍；（腳踏車、機車等的）座墊，鞍座
eng: a seat, often made of leather, used on a horse, bicycle, motorcycle, etc.
chisen: 他跨上馬鞍，騎馬走了。
engsen: He swung himself into the saddle and rode off .

eng: a large piece of meat taken from the middle of the back of an animal
chisen: 羊脊肉
engsen: saddle of lamb

chi: （基督教教會，尤指天主教教會正式追封的）聖徒，聖者；聖徒頭銜（聖徒的名字有時用作地名或建築物的名稱）
eng: (the title given to) a person who has received an official honour from the Christian, especially the Roman Catholic, Church for having lived in a good and holy way. The names of saints are sometimes used to name places and buildings
chisen: 聖保羅大教堂
engsen: Saint Paul's Cathedral

eng: (especially of people in the armed forces) to make a formal sign of respect to someone, especially by raising the right hand to the side of the head
chisen: 只要見到軍官就必須敬禮。
engsen: Whenever you see an officer , you must salute .

eng: (especially of people in the armed forces) to make a formal sign of respect to someone, especially by raising the right hand to the side of the head
chisen: 士兵們向上校敬禮。
engsen: The soldiers saluted the colonel .

eng: to honour or express admiration publicly for a person or an achievement
chisen: 在這個難忘的時刻，我們對協會出色的成就表示讚揚。
engsen: On this memorable occasion we salute the wonderful work done by the association .

eng: to honour or express admiration publicly for a person or an achievement
chisen: 我們向你的勇氣和決心致敬。
engsen: We salute you for your courage and determination .

eng: a light shoe, especially worn in warm weather, consisting of a bottom part held onto the foot by straps
chisen: 一雙涼鞋
engsen: a pair of sandals

eng: extremely violent, wild, or frightening
chisen: 兇猛的狗／野獸
engsen: a savage dog/beast

eng: extremely violent, wild, or frightening
chisen: 野蠻兇殘的攻擊
engsen: a brutal and savage attack

eng: to look at something carefully, with the eyes or with a machine, in order to get information
chisen: 她急切地盯著一張張走下火車的人的臉。
engsen: She anxiously scanned the faces of the men leaving the train .

eng: to look at something carefully, with the eyes or with a machine, in order to get information
chisen: 道格注視著海平面，搜尋著那隻船。
engsen: Doug scanned the horizon for any sign of the boat .

chi: 掃瞄（使用機器，將某一檔的圖片輸入到電腦中，或拍攝某物內部的圖片）
eng: to use a machine to put a picture of a document into a computer, or to take a picture of the inside of something
chisen: 我就把這篇文章掃瞄到電腦中。
engsen: I'll just scan the article into the computer .

chi: 掃瞄（使用機器，將某一檔的圖片輸入到電腦中，或拍攝某物內部的圖片）
eng: to use a machine to put a picture of a document into a computer, or to take a picture of the inside of something
chisen: 在自願者觀察這些圖片的同時，他們的腦部都經過掃瞄了。
engsen: Volunteers' brains were scanned while they looked at the pictures .

chi: 掃瞄（使用機器，將某一檔的圖片輸入到電腦中，或拍攝某物內部的圖片）
eng: to use a machine to put a picture of a document into a computer, or to take a picture of the inside of something
chisen: 所有手提行李都必須先經掃瞄。
engsen: All hand luggage has to be scanned .

eng: If a poem or part of a poem scans, it follows a pattern of regular beats.
chisen: 這行詩不合節拍——音節太多了。
engsen: This line doesn't scan - it has too many syllables .

eng: (an action or event that causes) a public feeling of shock and strong moral disapproval
chisen: 金融／政治／性醜聞
engsen: a financial/political/sex scandal

eng: (an action or event that causes) a public feeling of shock and strong moral disapproval
chisen: 他們的風流韻事在辦公室裡成了醜聞。
engsen: Their affair caused/created a scandal in the office .

eng: (an action or event that causes) a public feeling of shock and strong moral disapproval
chisen: 就在保守黨大會開幕的那一刻，醜聞曝了出來。
engsen: The scandal broke (= became public knowledge) right at the beginning of the Conservative Party Conference .

eng: a mark left on part of the body after an injury, such as a cut, has healed
chisen: 明顯的／顯眼的／醜陋的傷疤
engsen: a prominent/a noticeable/an ugly scar

eng: a mark left on part of the body after an injury, such as a cut, has healed
chisen: 燙傷會留下嚴重的傷疤。
engsen: That burn will leave a bad scar .

eng: a pleasant natural smell
chisen: 玫瑰的香味
engsen: the scent of roses

eng: an organized plan for doing something, especially something dishonest or illegal that will bring a good result for you
chisen: 他有一個輕率的／瘋狂的計劃，讓自己在20歲前致富。
engsen: He has a hare-brained/crazy scheme for getting rich before he's 20 .

eng: a very strong feeling of no respect for someone or something that you think is stupid or has no value
chisen: 她對新一代的政客只有鄙視。
engsen: She has nothing but scorn for the new generation of politicians .

eng: a very strong feeling of no respect for someone or something that you think is stupid or has no value
chisen: 你爲甚麽總是對我的建議嗤之以鼻？
engsen: Why do you always pour/heap scorn on (= criticize severely and unfairly) my suggestions ?

eng: to move or climb quickly but with difficulty, often using your hands to help you
chisen: 她爬上了陡峭的山坡，翻過岩石。
engsen: She scrambled up the steep hillside and over the rocks .

eng: to move or climb quickly but with difficulty, often using your hands to help you
chisen: 他匆匆套上衣服，跑去尋求救援。
engsen: He scrambled into his clothes (= put them on quickly) and raced to get help .

eng: to move or climb quickly but with difficulty, often using your hands to help you
chisen: 起火的飛機降落後，驚慌失措的乘客奮力向艙門口跑去。
engsen: As the burning plane landed , the terrified passengers scrambled for the door (= tried to reach the door quickly) .

chi: 打亂（單詞或字母使之不再有任何含義）
eng: to put things such as words or letters in the wrong order so that they do not make sense
chisen: 他興奮時通常會語無倫次。
engsen: He had a habit of scrambling his words when excited .

eng: to (cause a plane to) take off very quickly
chisen: 直升機在接到消息幾分鐘之後緊急起飛。
engsen: A helicopter was scrambled within minutes of the news .

eng: to not continue with a system or plan
chisen: 他們正在考慮廢除這個稅目，用其他方法募集款項。
engsen: They're considering scrapping the tax and raising the money in other ways .

eng: to not continue with a system or plan
chisen: 我們取消了法國之行的計劃。
engsen: We scrapped our plans for a trip to France .

eng: to remove an unwanted covering or a top layer from something, especially using a sharp edge or something rough
chisen: 進來前先把靴子擦乾淨。
engsen: Scrape your boots clean before you come in .

eng: to remove an unwanted covering or a top layer from something, especially using a sharp edge or something rough
chisen: 我們開車出去之前必須先掃除車上的積雪。
engsen: We'll have to scrape the snow off the car before we go out in it .

chisen: 「下地獄去吧！」他咆哮道。
engsen: "Go to hell!" , he snarled .

eng: to become twisted together and difficult to separate; to make something become twisted together
chisen: 毛線在她解開時交纏了起來。
engsen: The yarn snarled as she unwound it .

eng: to become twisted together and difficult to separate; to make something become twisted together
chisen: 那把舊梳子會讓你的頭髮纏起來。
engsen: That old brush will snarl your hair .

eng: to take hold of something suddenly and roughly
chisen: 我還沒來得及看，他就一把搶走了我手裡的照片。
engsen: He snatched the photos out of my hand before I had a chance to look at them .

eng: to take hold of something suddenly and roughly
chisen: 弗萊徹跑出了他職業生涯中的最好成績，從加拿大冠軍手中奪走了金牌。
engsen: Running the best race of his career , Fletcher snatched (= only just won) the gold medal from the Canadian champion .

chi: 偷偷地走，潛行；偷帶，偷拿
eng: to go somewhere secretly, or to take someone or something somewhere secretly
chisen: 我趁她不注意從後門偷偷溜了進來。
engsen: I managed to sneak in through the back door while she wasn't looking .

chi: 偷偷地走，潛行；偷帶，偷拿
eng: to go somewhere secretly, or to take someone or something somewhere secretly
chisen: 簡沒有票，但我想我們或許可以把她偷偷帶進去。
engsen: Jan doesn't have a ticket but I thought we might sneak her in .

chi: 偷偷地走，潛行；偷帶，偷拿
eng: to go somewhere secretly, or to take someone or something somewhere secretly
chisen: 我打算趁他不注意悄悄走到他身邊，嚇他一跳。
engsen: I thought I'd sneak up on him (= move close to him without him seeing) and give him a surprise .

chi: 告密；（尤指向老師）打小報告
eng: to secretly tell someone in authority, especially a teacher, that someone else has done something bad, often in order to cause trouble
chisen: 她總是向老師打小報告，說班裡其他孩子的壞話。
engsen: She was always sneaking on other kids in the class .

eng: to look at someone or something quickly and secretly
chisen: 我注意到他悄悄地偷看了一眼我正在寫的東西。
engsen: I noticed him sneak a look at what I was writing .

eng: to smell something by taking air in through your nose
chisen: 他嗅了嗅自己的襪子，看是否需要洗了。
engsen: He sniffed his socks to see if they needed washing .

eng: to smell something by taking air in through your nose
chisen: 狗喜歡相互嗅聞。
engsen: Dogs love sniffing each other .

eng: to smell something by taking air in through your nose
chisen: 品嚐那杯酒之前，她先聞了聞。
engsen: She sniffed at her glass of wine before tasting it .

eng: to breathe in a very noisy way while you are sleeping
chisen: 有時候我丈夫打鼾太吵，弄得我整夜無法入睡。
engsen: Sometimes my husband snores so loudly , it keeps me awake at night .

eng: to breathe in a very noisy way while you are sleeping
chisen: 你知道有甚麽辦法能治打呼嗎？
engsen: Do you know any cures for snoring ?

chi: 噴鼻息，從鼻中噴氣作聲
eng: to make an explosive sound by forcing air quickly up or down the nose
chisen: 他模仿了馬噴鼻息的聲音。
engsen: He did an impression of a horse snorting .

chi: 噴鼻息，從鼻中噴氣作聲
eng: to make an explosive sound by forcing air quickly up or down the nose
chisen: 卡米爾大笑的時候鼻腔裡會發出怪聲。
engsen: Camille snorts when she laughs .

chi: 噴鼻息，從鼻中噴氣作聲
eng: to make an explosive sound by forcing air quickly up or down the nose
chisen: 這時我不禁撲哧一聲笑起來。
engsen: By this time I was snorting with laughter (= laughing a lot and loudly) .

chi: 浸濕，把…濕透；（液體）滲入，滲透
eng: to make something very wet, or (of liquid) to be absorbed in large amounts
chisen: 雨被風吹進了屋裡，打濕了地毯。
engsen: The wind had blown the rain in and soaked the carpet .

chi: 浸濕，把…濕透；（液體）滲入，滲透
eng: to make something very wet, or (of liquid) to be absorbed in large amounts
chisen: 你最好把灑在地毯上的紅酒擦掉，免得滲進地毯裡。
engsen: You'd better wipe up that red wine you've spilled before it soaks (= is absorbed) into the carpet .

chi: 浸濕，把…濕透；（液體）滲入，滲透
eng: to make something very wet, or (of liquid) to be absorbed in large amounts
chisen: 血已經把兩條繃帶都浸透了。
engsen: Blood had soaked through both bandages .

eng: not drunk or affected by alcohol
chisen: 吉姆，你夠不夠清醒，可以開車嗎？
engsen: Are you sober enough to drive , Jim ?

eng: not drunk or affected by alcohol
chisen: 我一晚上沒有喝酒，所以我非常清醒。
engsen: I'd had no wine all evening so I was stone cold (= completely) sober .

eng: serious and calm
chisen: 事實上，整場婚禮氣氛很嚴肅——沒有人跳舞，人們只是聚在一起禮貌地交談。
engsen: In fact the whole wedding was a sober affair - no dancing , just people standing around in groups chatting politely .

eng: serious and calm
chisen: 安東尼表現得十分嚴肅——我整個晚上很少聽他笑過。
engsen: Anthony was in a very sober mood - I scarcely heard him laugh all night .

eng: to become soft, or to make something soft
chisen: 你可以把奶油稍微加熱使其變軟。
engsen: You can soften the butter by warming it gently .

eng: to become soft, or to make something soft
chisen: 如果你把這些蘋果乾浸在水中，它們就會變軟。
engsen: These dried apples will soften (up) if you soak them in water .

eng: to become more gentle or less strict, or to make someone do this
chisen: 這消息會讓他傷心——我們得想個辦法來緩和一下。
engsen: The news will upset him - we must think of a way to soften the blow (= make the news less unpleasant for him) .

eng: to become more gentle or less strict, or to make someone do this
chisen: 你說政府在法律法規方面的態度有所軟化了嗎？
engsen: Would you say the government's stance on law and order has softened ?

eng: being one only; single
chisen: 我唯一的目的就是讓更多的人能了解到這些資訊。
engsen: My sole objective is to make the information more widely available .

eng: being one only; single
chisen: 事故唯一的倖存者於六小時後在水裡被發現。
engsen: The sole survivor of the accident was found in the water after six hours .

eng: serious and without any humour
chisen: 嚴肅的臉／聲音
engsen: a solemn face/voice

eng: serious and without any humour
chisen: 大家看起來都很嚴肅。
engsen: Everyone looked very solemn .

eng: A solitary person or thing is the only person or thing in a place.
chisen: 山上，有個人正忙著砍樹。
engsen: On the hill , a solitary figure was busy chopping down trees .

eng: A solitary person or thing is the only person or thing in a place.
chisen: 遠處是一棟孤零零的建築。
engsen: In the distance was a solitary building .

eng: A solitary person or thing is the only person or thing in a place.
chisen: 他是個喜歡獨處的小孩。
engsen: He was a solitary child (= he enjoyed being alone) .

chi: 獨自的（地），單獨的（地），單人的（地）
eng: alone; without other people
chisen: 單人表演／飛行
engsen: a solo performance/flight

chi: 獨自的（地），單獨的（地），單人的（地）
eng: alone; without other people
chisen: 獨自航行／飛行
engsen: to sail/fly solo

chi: 獨自的（地），單獨的（地），單人的（地）
eng: alone; without other people
chisen: 他以前曾經加入過某個樂團，但如今已單獨發展。
engsen: He used to play with a group but now he's going solo/pursuing a solo career .

eng: to put seeds in or on the ground so that plants will grow
chisen: 把這些種子種在花盆裡。
engsen: Sow the seeds in pots .

eng: to put seeds in or on the ground so that plants will grow
chisen: 我們將在這塊田裡播種大麥。
engsen: We'll sow this field with barley .

eng: a vehicle used for travel in space
chisen: 載人／無人駕駛的太空船
engsen: a manned/unmanned spacecraft (= with/without people inside)

eng: someone who has a lot of experience, knowledge, or skill in a particular subject
chisen: 軟體專家
engsen: a software specialist

eng: someone who has a lot of experience, knowledge, or skill in a particular subject
chisen: 她是現代法國文學專家。
engsen: She's a specialist in modern French literature .

eng: something shown or examined as an example; a typical example
chisen: 他收集了很多稀有昆蟲的標本。
engsen: He has a collection of rare insect specimens .

eng: something shown or examined as an example; a typical example
chisen: 博物館願意出大價錢購買完好的恐龍化石標本。
engsen: Museums will pay large amounts of money for good dinosaur fossil specimens .

eng: something shown or examined as an example; a typical example
chisen: 太空人帶回了月球岩石的樣本。
engsen: Astronauts brought back specimens of moon rock .

chi: 不尋常的事；出人意料的情況
eng: an unusual or unexpected event or situation that attracts attention, interest, or disapproval
chisen: 見到兩個宿敵握手言歡，彼此拍肩，真是一幅奇怪的場景。
engsen: It was a strange spectacle to see the two former enemies shaking hands and slapping each other on the back .

chi: 不尋常的事；出人意料的情況
eng: an unusual or unexpected event or situation that attracts attention, interest, or disapproval
chisen: 我們目睹了一件奇事：有個老婦人爬上樹去救她的貓。
engsen: We witnessed the extraordinary spectacle of an old lady climbing a tree to rescue her cat .

eng: a public event or show that is exciting to watch; an exciting appearance
chisen: 嘉年華場面十分壯觀。
engsen: The carnival was a magnificent spectacle .

eng: a public event or show that is exciting to watch; an exciting appearance
chisen: 這個電視節目只不過是場面浩大而已。
engsen: The television show was mere spectacle (= had an exciting appearance , but little value) .

eng: glasses
chisen: 一副眼鏡
engsen: a pair of spectacles

eng: a person who watches an activity, especially a sports event, without taking part
chisen: 他們在四萬多名觀眾的加油聲中以四比零獲勝。
engsen: They won 4–0 in front of over 40,000 cheering spectators .

eng: the line of bones down the centre of the back that provides support for the body and protects the spinal cord
chisen: 她在一次墜馬事故中脊椎受傷。
engsen: She injured her spine in a riding accident .

eng: the line of bones down the centre of the back that provides support for the body and protects the spinal cord
chisen: 亞平寧山脈是義大利的中心山脈。
engsen: The Apennine mountains form the spine (= central row of mountains) of Italy .

eng: to run as fast as you can over a short distance, either in a race or because you are in a great hurry to get somewhere
chisen: 我們不得不飛奔趕上公車。
engsen: We had to sprint to catch the bus .

eng: to encourage an activity or development or make it happen faster
chisen: 消費的成長有刺激經濟加速發展的作用。
engsen: Rising consumer sales have the effect of spurring the economy to faster growth .

eng: to encourage an activity or development or make it happen faster
chisen: 受到之前成功的鼓勵，她緊接著又連續寫了四部小說。
engsen: Spurred (on) by her early success , she went on to write four more novels in rapid succession .

eng: to push spurs into the side of a horse to make it go faster
chisen: 他用馬刺策馬向前，嘴裡喊著「駕！駕！」
engsen: He spurred his horse on and shouted "Faster ! Faster!"

eng: to crush something into a flat shape
chisen: 他不小心坐在她的帽子上，把它坐扁了。
engsen: He accidentally sat on her hat and squashed it .

eng: to push yourself, a person, or thing into a small space
chisen: 房間裡擠得滿滿的，再也擠不進一個人了。
engsen: The room was so full you couldn't squash another person in .

eng: to push yourself, a person, or thing into a small space
chisen: 要是你們再擠擠，我們車裡就能多坐一個人。
engsen: If you all squashed up (= moved closer together) , we could fit an extra person in the car .

eng: to push yourself, a person, or thing into a small space
chisen: 他想趁他母親不注意，把他那條破洞牛仔褲塞進衣箱裡。
engsen: He tried to squash his ripped jeans into the suitcase while his mother wasn't looking .

eng: to stop something from continuing to exist or happen, by forceful action
chisen: 管理階層很快就消除了有關公司可能會被接管的謠言。
engsen: Rumours of a possible takeover of the company were soon squashed by the management .

eng: to position yourself close to the ground balancing on the front part of your feet with your legs bent under your body
chisen: 她蹲在地上，伸出雙手烤火。
engsen: She squatted on the ground and warmed her hands by the fire .

eng: to position yourself close to the ground balancing on the front part of your feet with your legs bent under your body
chisen: 他蹲下身來，檢查腳踏車的前輪。
engsen: He squatted down and examined the front wheel of his bike .

chi: 擅自佔用（空房或空地）；偷住
eng: to live in an empty building or area of land without the permission of the owner
chisen: 他們錢花光後，就偷偷住進了國王十字車站的一處舊房子裡。
engsen: They squatted (in) an old house in King's Cross when their money ran out .

eng: a pile of things arranged one on top of another
chisen: 他從架子上的一堆DVD中挑了盒卡通片。
engsen: He chose a cartoon from the stack of DVDs on the shelf .

chi: 搖晃；蹣跚；踉踉蹌蹌地走
eng: to walk or move with difficulty as if you are going to fall
chisen: 他遇襲後，跌跌撞撞地走到電話旁打電話求救。
engsen: After he was attacked , he managed to stagger to the phone and call for help .

chi: 搖晃；蹣跚；踉踉蹌蹌地走
eng: to walk or move with difficulty as if you are going to fall
chisen: 公司背負著1500萬美元的債務，舉步維艱，年底前幾乎肯定要倒閉。
engsen: The company is staggering under a $15 million debt and will almost certainly collapse by the end of the year .

eng: to cause someone to feel shocked or surprised because of something unexpected or very unusual happening
chisen: 他突然宣佈月底要離開公司，把所有同事都嚇了一跳。
engsen: He staggered all his colleagues by suddenly announcing that he was leaving the company at the end of the month .

chi: 使（尤指工作、假期或事件的時間）錯開；使交錯
eng: to arrange things, especially hours of work, holidays, or events, so that they begin at different times from those of other people
chisen: 一些國家將學校假期時間錯開，這樣度假地就不會太擁擠了。
engsen: Some countries have staggered school holidays so that holiday resorts do not become overcrowded .

eng: to leave a mark on something that is difficult to remove
chisen: 蕃茄醬一沾上就很麻煩——很難把它從衣服上洗掉。
engsen: Tomato sauce stains terribly - it's really difficult to get it out of clothes .

eng: to leave a mark on something that is difficult to remove
chisen: 她幫汽車換輪胎時，外套沾上了油污。
engsen: While she was changing the wheel on her car , her coat had become stained with oil .

eng: to permanently spoil something such as someone's reputation
chisen: 好幾位重要的政界人士都因爲這宗醜聞而名聲受損。
engsen: Several important politicians have had their reputations stained by this scandal .

eng: to permanently spoil something such as someone's reputation
chisen: 這個國家的歷史沾滿了數百萬無辜者的鮮血。
engsen: The country's history is stained with the blood of (= the country is guilty of killing) millions of innocent men and women .

eng: a share or a financial involvement in something such as a business
chisen: 他擁有公司40%的股份。
engsen: He holds (= owns) a 40 percent stake in/of the company .

eng: a strong stick or metal bar with a pointed end
chisen: 將木樁插入地下，可以用來支撐植物或構成圍欄。
engsen: The stakes are pushed or hammered into the ground and can be used for supporting a plant or forming part of a fence .

chi: （植物的）莖，稈；（葉或果實的）柄，蒂；（花）梗
eng: the main stem of a plant, or the narrow stem that joins leaves, flowers, or fruit to the main stem of a plant
chisen: 她修剪了一下鬱金香的花梗，然後把它們插進了花瓶。
engsen: She trimmed the stalks of the tulips before putting them in a vase .

eng: a large table or a small shop with an open front from which goods are sold in a public place
chisen: 村子市集的攤位上高高堆著當地産的蔬菜。
engsen: In the village market , the stalls are piled high with local vegetables .

chi: 使大吃一驚；使受驚，使嚇一跳
eng: to do something unexpected that surprises and sometimes worries a person or animal
chisen: 她正在聚精會神地看書，被他的聲音嚇了一跳。
engsen: She was concentrating on her book and his voice startled her .

chi: 使大吃一驚；使受驚，使嚇一跳
eng: to do something unexpected that surprises and sometimes worries a person or animal
chisen: 汽車聲把一大群鳥驚嚇得振翅飛了起來。
engsen: The noise of the car startled the birds and the whole flock flew up into the air .

chi: 使大吃一驚；使受驚，使嚇一跳
eng: to do something unexpected that surprises and sometimes worries a person or animal
chisen: 她那篇有關飲食的文章使很多人惶惶不安，開始改變飲食習慣。
engsen: Her article on diet startled many people into changing their eating habits .

eng: information based on a study of the number of times something happens or is present, or other numerical facts
chisen: 統計資料顯示女性壽命比男性長。
engsen: Statistics show/suggest that women live longer than men .

eng: information based on a study of the number of times something happens or is present, or other numerical facts
chisen: 根據官方統計數字，日本人比其他大多數工業國家勞工的工作時間都要長。
engsen: According to official statistics , the Japanese work longer hours than workers in most other industrialized countries .

eng: a container with holes in the bottom that is put over boiling water in order to cook food in steam, or a machine that cooks food with steam
chisen: 米飯蒸鍋
engsen: a rice steamer

eng: a container with holes in the bottom that is put over boiling water in order to cook food in steam, or a machine that cooks food with steam
chisen: 蔬菜蒸籠
engsen: a vegetable steamer

chi: 駕駛（交通工具）；掌方向盤
eng: to control the direction of a vehicle
chisen: 她小心開車繞過那些坑洞。
engsen: She carefully steered the car around the potholes .

chi: 駕駛（交通工具）；掌方向盤
eng: to control the direction of a vehicle
chisen: 這輛車很容易開。
engsen: This car is very easy to steer .

chi: （尤指錯誤的）刻板印象，老套俗見，成見
eng: a set idea that people have about what someone or something is like, especially an idea that is wrong
chisen: 他不符合一般人心目中法國人的形象。
engsen: He doesn't conform to/fit/fill the national stereotype of a Frenchman .

chi: （尤指錯誤的）刻板印象，老套俗見，成見
eng: a set idea that people have about what someone or something is like, especially an idea that is wrong
chisen: 書中的人物毫無新意。
engsen: The characters in the book are just stereotypes .

eng: severe, or showing disapproval
chisen: 嚴厲的目光／警告／語氣
engsen: a stern look/warning/voice

eng: severe, or showing disapproval
chisen: 記者受到嚴厲警告，不得靠近軍艦。
engsen: Journalists received a stern warning not to go anywhere near the battleship .

chi: （通常由肉或魚加蔬菜製成的）燉菜，燜菜
eng: a type of food consisting usually of meat or fish and vegetables cooked slowly in a small amount of liquid
chisen: 她為晚餐準備了一道豐盛的燉菜。
engsen: She prepared a hearty stew for dinner .

chi: （特定活動的）組織者，操辦者；服務員；管家；管理員
eng: a person whose job it is to organize a particular event, or to provide services to particular people, or to take care of a particular place
chisen: 執事將在九點鐘檢查跑道。
engsen: Stewards will be inspecting the race track at 9.00 .

chi: （特定活動的）組織者，操辦者；服務員；管家；管理員
eng: a person whose job it is to organize a particular event, or to provide services to particular people, or to take care of a particular place
chisen: 會議期間，您任何時候需要幫助，服務人員都會很樂意為您效勞。
engsen: If you need help at any time during the conference , one of the stewards will be pleased to help you .

eng: someone whose job is to be in a place and help visitors or customers
chisen: 衣帽間服務員／博物館解說員
engsen: a cloakroom/museum attendant

chi: 散發異味，發出難聞的氣味
eng: to smell very unpleasant
chisen: 你的腳好臭！
engsen: Your feet stink !

eng: to be extremely bad or unpleasant
chisen: 我覺得她整個態度令人噁心。
engsen: I think her whole attitude stinks .

eng: to be extremely bad or unpleasant
chisen: 他的演技一塌糊塗，但人長得帥，所以獲邀在許多影片中演出。
engsen: His acting stinks but he looks good , so he's offered lots of movie roles .

eng: a supply of something for use or sale
chisen: 現在冬天剛剛過半，但食物的儲備已經不足。
engsen: It is now halfway through winter and food stocks are already low .

eng: a supply of something for use or sale
chisen: 本地商店備有大量明信片和旅遊指南。
engsen: The local shop has a good stock of postcards and guidebooks .

eng: a supply of something for use or sale
chisen: 城市中許多房子都有100多年歷史了。
engsen: Much of the city's housing stock (= the number of houses in the city) is over 100 years old .

eng: the amount of money that a company has through selling shares to people
chisen: 他們擁有公司20%股份。
engsen: They own 20 percent of the company's stock .

eng: the degree to which a person or organization is popular and respected
chisen: 目前，首相的聲望很高／低。
engsen: At present , the prime minister's stock is high/low .

chi: （人的）祖先，血統，家族，世系；（動物的）種，原種
eng: the family or group that a person or animal comes from
chisen: 他是個愛爾蘭血統的美國人。
engsen: He's an American of Irish stock .

eng: a force or influence that stretches, pulls, or puts pressure on something, sometimes causing damage

eng: a thin thread of something, often one of a few, twisted around each other to make a string or rope

chi: 經歷，遭受（尤指破壞或損失）
eng: to suffer or experience, especially damage or loss
chisen: 公司今年遭受嚴重的虧損。
engsen: The company has sustained heavy losses this year .

eng: to support emotionally
chisen: 宗教信仰的力量支撐著她。
engsen: She was sustained by the strength of her religious faith .

eng: to support emotionally
chisen: 家人和朋友的愛支撐著我渡過難關。
engsen: The love of my family and friends sustained me through my ordeal .

eng: (an area of) very wet, soft land
chisen: 鱷魚成群的沼澤地
engsen: an alligator-infested swamp

eng: (an area of) very wet, soft land
chisen: 佛羅裡達大濕地是佛羅裡達州南部的一片沼澤地區。
engsen: The Everglades are an area of swamp in southern Florida .

eng: a large group of insects all moving together
chisen: 一大群蜜蜂／黃蜂／螞蟻／蝗蟲
engsen: a swarm of bees/wasps/ants/locusts

eng: a large group of insects all moving together
chisen: 這頭死羊身上爬滿一群群的蒼蠅。
engsen: The dead sheep was covered with swarms of flies .

eng: to understand and care about someone's problems
chisen: 我知道偏頭痛有多難受，所以我真的很同情你。
engsen: I know what it's like to have migraines , so I really sympathize (with you) .

eng: to support and agree with someone or something
chisen: 我支持這個機構的總目標，但在這個具體議題上，恐怕我不能苟同。
engsen: I sympathize with the general aims of the organization , but on this particular issue I disagree .

eng: to try to deal with something or someone
chisen: 處理這個問題有許多辦法。
engsen: There are many ways of tackling this problem .

eng: to try to deal with something or someone
chisen: 就他工作馬虎一事，我與他進行了交涉。
engsen: I tackled him about his careless work .

eng: pleasantly brown skin caused by being in the hot sun
chisen: 曬得黝黑的皮膚
engsen: a deep tan

eng: an untidy mass of things that are not in a state of order, or a state of confusion or difficulty
chisen: 一團亂糟糟的電線
engsen: a tangle of wires

eng: to intentionally annoy and upset someone by making unkind remarks to them, laughing unkindly, etc.
chisen: 其他孩子以前經常在操場上嘲笑他，因為他長得胖，還戴眼鏡。
engsen: The other kids used to taunt him in the playground because he was fat and wore glasses .

eng: the speed at which an event happens
chisen: 如果我們想如期完成的話，我們必須加快工作進度。
engsen: We're going to have to up the tempo (= work faster) if we want to finish on time .

eng: to make someone want to have or do something, especially something that is unnecessary or wrong
chisen: 可享受免費貸款讓她禁不住誘惑買了一輛新車。
engsen: The offer of free credit tempted her into buying a new car .

eng: to make someone want to have or do something, especially something that is unnecessary or wrong
chisen: 他們承諾給他優厚的薪水和一輛公司汽車，以吸引他加入該公司。
engsen: They tempted him to join the company by offering him a huge salary and a company car .

eng: the wish to do or have something that you know you should not do or have
chisen: 作為一名年輕女演員，她抵擋住了前往好萊塢的誘惑。
engsen: As a young actress , she resisted the temptation to move to Hollywood .

chi: （計劃、想法、建議、行動等）試驗（性）的，試探（性）的，暫時的
eng: (of a plan or idea) not certain or agreed, or (of a suggestion or action) said or done in a careful but uncertain way because you do not know if you are right
chisen: 我暫定七月去西雅圖旅行。
engsen: I have tentative plans to take a trip to Seattle in July .

eng: (of a disease or illness) leading gradually to death
chisen: 她患有末期癌症。
engsen: She has terminal cancer .

eng: extreme, when referring to something unpleasant or negative
chisen: 她聲稱造船業已經衰敗到極點。
engsen: She claims that the shipbuilding industry is in terminal decline .

eng: extreme, when referring to something unpleasant or negative
chisen: 他終日無所事事，極其無聊。
engsen: He has nothing to do all day and is suffering from terminal boredom .

eng: a feeling of extreme excitement, usually caused by something pleasant
chisen: 贏得比賽的激動
engsen: the thrill of winning a competition

eng: a feeling of extreme excitement, usually caused by something pleasant
chisen: 那麼為甚麼人們還去打獵——是不是因為追捕獵物讓人感到興奮刺激?
engsen: So why do people still go hunting - is it the thrill of the chase ?

eng: a feeling of extreme excitement, usually caused by something pleasant
chisen: 這麼多年以後與她重逢，著實令我激動。
engsen: It gave me a real thrill to see her again after so many years .

chi: （常指關於偵破罪案的）驚悚小說（或戲劇、電影）
eng: a book, play, or film that has an exciting story, often about solving a crime
chisen: 該作品在這處被稱為結構嚴密的心理驚悚小說。
engsen: It's described here as a taut psychological thriller .

eng: a crowd or large group of people
chisen: 講者周圍聚集了一大群人。
engsen: A huge throng had gathered around the speaker .

eng: to push suddenly and strongly
chisen: 她把錢塞進他手中。
engsen: She thrust the money into his hand .

eng: to push suddenly and strongly
chisen: 他們把麥克風推到我面前，不斷向我發問。
engsen: They thrust a microphone in front of me and fired questions at me .

eng: to push suddenly and strongly
chisen: 她把報紙塞給我。
engsen: She thrust the papers at me (= towards me) .

eng: a mark (✓) that shows that something is correct or has been done
chisen: 在接受邀請的人的姓名上打鉤。
engsen: Put a tick by/against the names of the people who have accepted the invitation .

eng: a very short time
chisen: 稍等一會兒——我還沒準備好。
engsen: Hold on/Hang on a tick - I'm not quite ready .

eng: a very short time
chisen: 我馬上就到。
engsen: I'll be with you in a tick/in two ticks .

eng: to (cause to) move into a sloping position
chisen: 他把椅子向後傾，雙腳擱在書桌上。
engsen: He tilted his chair backwards and put his feet up on his desk .

eng: to (cause to) move into a sloping position
chisen: 安娜歪著腦袋，抬眼望著他。
engsen: Anna looked up at him with her head tilted to one side .

eng: to (cause to) move into a sloping position
chisen: 汽車的前座可以傾斜。
engsen: The front seats of the car tilt .

eng: a closed metal container in which food is sold
chisen: 一罐豆子
engsen: a tin of beans

eng: a closed metal container in which food is sold
chisen: 一大堆湯罐頭盒
engsen: piles of soup tins

eng: on your toes with the heel of your foot lifted off the ground
chisen: 為了摘到樹上的蘋果，孩子們踮起了腳尖。
engsen: The children stood on tiptoe in order to pick the apples from the tree .

eng: on your toes with the heel of your foot lifted off the ground
chisen: 他們躡手躡腳地穿過房間，生怕驚醒嬰兒。
engsen: They walked across the room on tiptoe so as not to wake the baby .

eng: a small, brown animal, similar to a frog, that has big eyes and long back legs for swimming and jumping
chisen: 蟾蜍的皮比青蛙乾燥，疙瘩也更多，留在水中的時間比青蛙少。
engsen: Toads have drier , lumpier skins than frogs and spend less time in the water .

chi: 極令人討厭的人；（尤指）醜八怪
eng: an extremely unpleasant man, especially one who is not very physically attractive
chisen: 你這個愛撒謊的醜八怪！
engsen: You lying toad !

eng: hard work, especially work that makes you feel physically tired
chisen: 林迪在做了多年的苦工後才過上舒適的生活。
engsen: Lindi has achieved her comfortable life only after years of hard toil .

eng: hard work, especially work that makes you feel physically tired
chisen: 好啦，在辦公室勞累了一天，我想歇一會兒兒。
engsen: Well , after a day's toil in the office I like to relax a little .

eng: something that you do, or a thing that you give someone, that expresses your feelings or intentions, although it might have little practical effect
chisen: 為了表示我們對你們所做的一切的感謝，希望你們接受我們這份小小的禮物。
engsen: As a token of our gratitude for all that you have done , we would like you to accept this small gift .

eng: something that you do, or a thing that you give someone, that expresses your feelings or intentions, although it might have little practical effect
chisen: 禮物不必大——只是為了表示一下。
engsen: It doesn't have to be a big present - it's just a token .

eng: a piece of paper with a particular amount of money printed on it that can be exchanged in a shop for goods of that value
chisen: 一張價值20英鎊的書券／禮券／唱片券
engsen: a £20 book/gift/record token

eng: a small light that is held in the hand and usually gets its power from batteries
chisen: 她用手電筒照了照黑暗的房間。
engsen: She flashed/shone the torch into the dark room .

eng: great mental suffering and unhappiness, or great physical pain
chisen: 這家人說多年來他們一直忍受著鄰居們的欺淩羞辱。
engsen: The family said they had endured years of torment and abuse at the hands of their neighbours .

eng: great mental suffering and unhappiness, or great physical pain
chisen: 等待醫療檢查的結果簡直就是一種折磨。
engsen: Waiting for the result of the medical tests was sheer torment .

eng: great mental suffering and unhappiness, or great physical pain
chisen: 他在痛苦中渡過了那個晚上，思量著最好該怎麼做。
engsen: He spent the night in torment , trying to decide what was the best thing to do .

chi: （尤指似乎無法控制的）狂潮，迸發
eng: a sudden large or too large amount, especially one that seems to be uncontrolled
chisen: 他連珠炮地說了一大堆謾罵／生氣的話。
engsen: He let out a torrent of abuse/angry words .

chi: （尤指似乎無法控制的）狂潮，迸發
eng: a sudden large or too large amount, especially one that seems to be uncontrolled
chisen: 他們擔心如果不進行控制，這些川流不息／涓涓細流般／源源不斷的遊客會匯集成一股難以應付的洪流。
engsen: They are worried that the flow/trickle/stream of tourists could swell into an unmanageable torrent if there are no controls .

eng: the act of causing great physical or mental pain in order to persuade someone to do something or to give information, or to be cruel to a person or animal
chisen: 半數的囚犯死於拷打和饑餓。
engsen: Half of the prisoners died after torture and starvation .

eng: the act of causing great physical or mental pain in order to persuade someone to do something or to give information, or to be cruel to a person or animal
chisen: 在嚴刑拷打之下，他吐露了秘密。
engsen: He revealed the secret under torture .

eng: a competition for teams or single players in which a series of games is played, and the winners of each game play against each other until only one winner is left
chisen: 網球／西洋棋／高爾夫球錦標賽
engsen: a tennis/chess/golf tournament

eng: a competition for teams or single players in which a series of games is played, and the winners of each game play against each other until only one winner is left
chisen: 他們在錦標賽的第一輪就被打敗了。
engsen: They were defeated in the first round of the tournament .

eng: a name or symbol on a product that shows it was made by a particular company, and that it cannot be used by other companies without permission
chisen: 維可牢是一個註冊商標。
engsen: Velcro is a registered trademark .

eng: something very noticeable that a person typically has or does
chisen: 他戴著一條有個人特色的亮色領帶。
engsen: He was wearing one of the brightly coloured ties that are his trademark .

eng: something very noticeable that a person typically has or does
chisen: 她展露她那特有的微笑。
engsen: She gave one of her trademark smiles .

eng: a person who is not loyal or stops being loyal to their own country, social class, beliefs, etc.
chisen: 叛亂的首領被作為叛國者絞死了。
engsen: The leaders of the rebellion were hanged as traitors .

eng: a person who is not loyal or stops being loyal to their own country, social class, beliefs, etc.
chisen: 中國共產黨稱戈巴契夫先生為「社會主義的叛徒」。
engsen: The Chinese Communist Party branded (= called) Mr Gorbachev "a traitor to socialism" .

chi: （眾人一齊走時發出的）沉重的腳步聲
eng: the sound of people all walking together with heavy steps
chisen: 街上迴盪著士兵們重重的腳步聲。
engsen: The streets echoed with the tramp of soldiers' feet .

eng: to step heavily on something or someone, causing damage or injury
chisen: 有人把我的花壇全部踩壞了！
engsen: Somebody trampled all over my flowerbeds !

eng: to step heavily on something or someone, causing damage or injury
chisen: 體育場突然倒塌時，人群衝進足球場，其間八人被踩踏致死。
engsen: Eight people were trampled to death (= killed) when the stadium collapsed and the crowd rushed out onto the football pitch .

eng: to act without any respect for someone or something
chisen: 她譴責政府無視普通公民的需求和權利。
engsen: She accused the government of trampling on the needs and rights of the ordinary citizen .

eng: to act without any respect for someone or something
chisen: 他認為，國會在新的福利改革法中侵犯了合法移民享有的憲法所賦予的權利。
engsen: He argues that Congress trampled the constitutional rights of legal immigrants in the new welfare reform law .

eng: If a substance or object is transparent, you can see through it very clearly.
chisen: 把球莖種在透明的塑膠盒裡，這樣孩子就能看到根的生長。
engsen: Grow the bulbs in a transparent plastic box , so the children can see the roots growing .

eng: If a substance or object is transparent, you can see through it very clearly.
chisen: 她的襯衫幾乎是透明的！
engsen: Her blouse was practically transparent !

chi: 清楚易懂的；顯而易見的
eng: clear and easy to understand or recognize
chisen: 我覺得我們應該盡可能使這些指示更清楚易懂些。
engsen: I think we should try to make the instructions more transparent .

chi: 公開和誠實的，無秘密的
eng: open and honest, without secrets
chisen: 我們致力於讓收費完全透明。
engsen: We are committed to being totally transparent about our charges .

eng: a written agreement between two or more countries, formally approved and signed by their leaders
chisen: 和平條約
engsen: a peace treaty

eng: a written agreement between two or more countries, formally approved and signed by their leaders
chisen: 歐盟條約
engsen: the treaty on European union

eng: a written agreement between two or more countries, formally approved and signed by their leaders
chisen: 我們和幾個鄰國簽署／締結了限制有害氣體排放的條約。
engsen: We've signed/concluded a treaty with neighbouring states to limit emissions of harmful gases .

eng: a narrow hole that is dug into the ground
chisen: 一名工人在挖壕溝時，由於兩側坍塌而喪生。
engsen: A workman was killed when the sides of the trench he was working in collapsed .

chi: （尤指在正式場合表達敬意的）頌詞，禮物
eng: something that you say, write, or give that shows your respect and admiration for someone, especially on a formal occasion
chisen: 昨天這位著名演員去世後，世界各國人士紛紛表示哀悼。
engsen: Tributes have been pouring in from all over the world for the famous actor who died yesterday .

chi: （尤指在正式場合表達敬意的）頌詞，禮物
eng: something that you say, write, or give that shows your respect and admiration for someone, especially on a formal occasion
chisen: 葬禮用花
engsen: floral tributes (= flowers sent to someone's funeral)

chi: 是（優秀、強大或有效性）的明證
eng: to show clearly how good, strong, or effective something or someone is
chisen: 我從沒見過一個五歲的小孩像你兒子這麼乖——你真行！
engsen: I've never met a five-year-old as well behaved as your son - he's a tribute to you !

chi: 是（優秀、強大或有效性）的明證
eng: to show clearly how good, strong, or effective something or someone is
chisen: 他所取得的成績充分證明了22年來他的決心有多麼堅定。
engsen: It is a tribute to his determination over his 22 years that he has achieved so much .

chi: 鮮奶油鬆糕，果醬鬆糕（一種甜點，包括一層水果海綿蛋糕、一層蛋奶醬和一層鮮奶油）
eng: a sweet cold dish consisting of a layer of fruit and cake, a layer of custard (= thick, sweet, yellow sauce) and a top layer of cream
chisen: 雪利酒浸果醬鬆糕
engsen: a sherry trifle

eng: a matter or object of little value or importance
chisen: 我從印度帶回來幾樣小玩意——主要是些首飾和布料。
engsen: I brought a few trifles back from India - pieces of jewellery and fabric mainly .

eng: to make something tidier or more level by cutting a small amount off it
chisen: 修剪樹籬
engsen: to trim the hedge

eng: to make something tidier or more level by cutting a small amount off it
chisen: 我的頭髮需要剪一剪。
engsen: My hair needs trimming .

eng: to make something tidier or more level by cutting a small amount off it
chisen: 烹飪之前，去掉菜多葉的一端。
engsen: Trim off the leafy ends of the vegetable before cooking .

eng: to reduce the amount or size of something
chisen: 他們正試圖降低成本，所以沒有安排填補離職員工的空缺。
engsen: They're trying to trim their costs , so staff who leave are not being replaced .

eng: having three parts of the same type, or happening three times
chisen: 她的教練是三屆奧運會冠軍。
engsen: Her trainer is a triple Olympic champion .

eng: having three parts of the same type, or happening three times
chisen: 下週日將有三部希區考克的影片在這家電影院上映。
engsen: There's a triple bill of Hitchcock films (= three films) on at the cinema next Sunday .

eng: If a horse or similar animal with four legs trots, it runs at its slowest speed, using short steps in which a front leg and the back leg on the opposite side move together.
chisen: 她正騎著馬駒小跑著。
engsen: She was trotting along on her pony .

eng: If a horse or similar animal with four legs trots, it runs at its slowest speed, using short steps in which a front leg and the back leg on the opposite side move together.
chisen: 這隻狗沿路小跑著過來迎接我。
engsen: The dog trotted down the path to greet me .

eng: When people trot somewhere, they go there in a quick or busy way.
chisen: 她跟在我身後沿著街道小跑著。
engsen: She came trotting down the street after me .

eng: a fish that lives in rivers and lakes, or lives in the sea but returns to rivers to produce its eggs, that is a popular food
chisen: 成千上萬條鮭魚和鱒魚的幼魚因污染而死亡。
engsen: Thousands of young salmon and trout have been killed by pollution .

eng: a fish that lives in rivers and lakes, or lives in the sea but returns to rivers to produce its eggs, that is a popular food
chisen: 這座湖以捕鮭魚而聞名。
engsen: The lake is famous for its trout fishing .

chi: 老傢夥；（尤指）討厭的婆娘，惡婆子
eng: an old person, especially a woman, who is unpleasant or not attractive
chisen: 她是個令人討厭、滿腹牢騷的老太婆。
engsen: She's a miserable old trout who complains about everything .

eng: to push a loose end of a piece of clothing or material into a particular place or position, especially to make it tidy or comfortable
chisen: 我應該把襯衫下擺塞進褲子裡嗎？
engsen: Should I tuck my shirt into my trousers ?

eng: to push a loose end of a piece of clothing or material into a particular place or position, especially to make it tidy or comfortable
chisen: 他把床單邊緣塞入床墊下。
engsen: He tucked the bottom of the sheet under the mattress .

eng: to put something into a safe or convenient place
chisen: 把手套放進口袋裡，這樣就不會弄丟了。
engsen: Tuck your gloves in your pocket so that you don't lose them .

eng: to put something into a safe or convenient place
chisen: 她把玩具娃娃夾在胳膊下。
engsen: She had a doll tucked under her arm .

eng: to put something into a safe or convenient place
chisen: 最後我發現證書壓在一堆舊帳單下。
engsen: Eventually I found the certificate tucked under a pile of old bills .

eng: to hold part of your body in a particular position
chisen: 站直了，收腹提臀。
engsen: Stand up straight , tuck your tummy in and tuck your bottom under .

eng: to hold part of your body in a particular position
chisen: 她盤腿坐著。
engsen: She sat with her legs tucked under her .

eng: to be in a place that is hidden or where few people go
chisen: 這條巷子的深處有一些漂亮的老房子。
engsen: Tucked along/down this alley are some beautiful old houses .

eng: to be in a place that is hidden or where few people go
chisen: 工廠後面隱藏著一片小磚房。
engsen: A group of tiny brick houses is tucked away behind the factory .

chi: （尤指一對一或小班進行的）教學，講授，指導
eng: teaching, especially when given to a small group or one person, such as in a college or university
chisen: 所有學生都學習邏輯學和玄學。
engsen: All students receive tuition in logic and metaphysics .

eng: a large fish that lives in warm seas
chisen: 成群的金槍魚
engsen: shoals of tuna

chi: 暴君；暴虐的人；專橫的人
eng: a ruler who has unlimited power over other people, and uses it unfairly and cruelly
chisen: 泰咪爾是被放逐的幾個君主兒子中的一個，他發誓要把國家從暴君手中解放出來。
engsen: Tamir , one of several sons of the exiled ruler , vowed he would liberate his country from the tyrant .

chi: 暴君；暴虐的人；專橫的人
eng: a ruler who has unlimited power over other people, and uses it unfairly and cruelly
chisen: 我的老闆似乎一夜之間變成了一個暴君。
engsen: Overnight my boss seems to have turned into a tyrant .

eng: a person who is present at a sports competition in order to make certain that the rules of that particular game are obeyed and to judge if particular actions are acceptable
chisen: 板球／網球裁判
engsen: a cricket/tennis umpire

chi: （尤指爲了強調）在（詞語）下面畫線
eng: to draw a line under a word, especially in order to show its importance
chisen: 所有術語的下面都畫了紅線。
engsen: All the technical words have been underlined in red .

eng: under or below
chisen: 隧道正好位於城下。
engsen: The tunnel goes right underneath the city .

eng: under or below
chisen: 他們在車底下發現了一枚炸彈。
engsen: They found a bomb underneath the car .

eng: under or below

chisen: 他舉辦了一場典型的百萬富翁式的聚會。
engsen: He threw a party worthy of a millionaire .

eng: an arrangement of flowers and leaves in a circular shape, used as a decoration or as a sign of respect and remembrance for a person who has died

engsen: a holly/laurel wreath

eng: an arrangement of flowers and leaves in a circular shape, used as a decoration or as a sign of respect and remembrance for a person who has died
chisen: 新娘戴著一塊飾有絲綢花環的面紗。
engsen: The bride wore a veil with a wreath of silk flowers .

eng: an arrangement of flowers and leaves in a circular shape, used as a decoration or as a sign of respect and remembrance for a person who has died
chisen: 棺材上擺放著兩個巨大的花圈。
engsen: There were two large wreaths on the coffin .

eng: a boat with sails and sometimes an engine, used for either racing or travelling on for pleasure

engsen: a luxury yacht

eng: a boat with sails and sometimes an engine, used for either racing or travelling on for pleasure

eng: a story, usually a long one with a lot of excitement or interest

engsen: He knew how to spin a good yarn (= tell a good story) .

eng: to supply or produce something positive such as a profit, an amount of food or information

engsen: an attempt to yield increased profits

eng: to supply or produce something positive such as a profit, an amount of food or information

engsen: The investigation yielded some unexpected results .

eng: to supply or produce something positive such as a profit, an amount of food or information

eng: to give up the control of or responsibility for something, often because you have been forced to

engsen: They were forced to yield (up) their land to the occupying forces .

engsen: His legs began to yield under the sheer weight of his body .

chi: 停車讓道（以讓其他車輛通過）
eng: to stop in order to allow other vehicles to go past, especially before you drive onto a bigger road

engsen: If you're going downhill , you need to yield to bikers going uphill .

engsen: a yoga class

engsen: They got into the car and zoomed off .
